title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB

title: Sources: Mixon not expected to play this season
content: Texans running back Joe Mixon is not expected to return this season because of a foot injury, sources told ESPN.

title: Lakers fire Buss brothers from scouting roles
content: The Lakers are reorganizing their basketball operations department and have terminated brothers Joey and Jesse Buss from their respective front office positions.

title: NWSL vows to 'fight' to keep Rodman in league
content: NWSL commissioner Jessica Berman said Thursday that the NWSL is prepared to do what it takes to keep Washington Spirit and United States forward Trinity Rodman in the league.

title: WC playoff draw: Italy to face Northern Ireland
content: Italy will first host Northern Ireland in a World Cup qualifying playoff in March but would then need to win on the road to reach its first tournament after back-to-back failures at this stage.

title: Sources: Rhoades expected to exit as Baylor AD
content: Baylor is expected to announce the departure of athletic director Mack Rhoades in the near future, sources told ESPN.

title: Okamoto, Takahashi join NPB stars posted for MLB
content: Infielder Kazuma Okamoto and pitcher Kona Takahashi are entering MLB's posting system and will be available to sign as free agents from Friday through Jan. 4.

title: Mariners to retire Johnson's No. 51 in '26 season
content: Hall of Fame left-hander Randy Johnson will have his No. 51 retired by the Seattle Mariners during a pregame ceremony on May 2, 2026, the club announced Thursday.

title: Browns, DE Wright reach 3-year, $33M extension
content: The Browns and defensive end Alex Wright reached agreement Thursday on a three-year, $33 million extension that includes $21 million guaranteed, his agents told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

content: The Wildcats added another statement win to their early-season r√©sum√©, headlining this week's top-25 risers.

content: Butler has taken on a mentorship role with Kuminga, who is still trying to find his role with the Warriors.

content: The Eagles' head coach is 56-22 over five seasons, including two trips to the Super Bowl. Yet he's constantly under the microscope. Why?

content: Our college football experts tell us what's at stake in key conference matchups, plus breakout players and more.

content: Why Travis Hunter, Jeremiah Smith and Caitlin Clark have custom shoes from this Houston Christian freshman.

content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to Bahamas tournaments, the next 10 days are filled with big nonconference games.

content: Stingley has 14 interceptions since 2022, but he doesn't want to talk about them. He is much more interested in the plays he almost made.

content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: NWSL faces litmus test to retain Trinity Rodman's star power
content: Trinity Rodman represents some of the very best that the NWSL has to offer. That's why Saturday's NWSL Championship -- perhaps her final game -- feels so significant.

title: Oklahoma's anthracite alternates headline top college football uniforms for Week 13
content: Oklahoma will ditch their usual crimson and cream color palette for just this week, donning their anthracite "Unity" alternates against Missouri.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: Bradley's take: Can Haney avoid Norman's left hook?
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down the Brian Norman Jr.-Devin Haney title fight, and shares his thoughts on how the fight could play out.

title: The running man: Odds are Josh Allen makes QB TD history on Thursday night
content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lauri Markkanen averages 30 PPG all season
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Lauri Markannen, two Pelicans rookies and a number of Celtics' scorers in the months ahead.

title: 2026 World Cup playoff draw: Who will fill the final six spots?
content: Six spots remain up for grabs at the 2026 World Cup, with four to emerge from Europe and a further two from an intercontinental playoff. What's the draw, and who will advance? We make our picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Ajax young talent Mokio
content: Manchester United are keeping tabs on rising young talent Jorthy Mokio from Ajax. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Mega deal: India to buy Javelin missiles, Excalibur munitions; big boost in defence
content: India is set to acquire advanced US weaponry, including Excalibur precision artillery munitions and Javelin anti-tank missiles, for $93 million. These deals bolster India's defense capabilities, complementing recent acquisitions like GE engines for Tejas fighters. Despite ongoing trade talks, these military procurements underscore the strengthening strategic ties between India and the US.

title: 'Hands, legs missing': Child's dismembered body found near Gurugram eway; cops scan CCTV
content: Police in Gurugram have launched a murder probe after a dismembered child‚Äôs body was found along the KMP expressway, triggering panic locally. The torso, head and one leg were recovered, while other limbs are missing. The child, believed to be about seven, had severe facial injuries. Police are checking missing-child records and CCTV, suspecting a sharp-edged weapon was used.

title: Bazball reaches its endgame; Eng's hopes hinge on raw pace to recreate Bodyline
content: England enter the Ashes with their quickest pace attack in decades and a matured Bazball philosophy, aiming to end a 15-year drought in Australia. With Mark Wood, Jofra Archer and a battery of genuine quicks, Ben Stokes‚Äô side arrives believing speed can break the long-standing barrier. For Bazball, this is the defining series: victory brings vindication, defeat invites its fiercest scrutiny yet.

title: Digital ID: iPhones get passport storage; all you need to know
content: Apple's new Digital ID allows iPhone and Apple Watch users to store US passport information in Apple Wallet for TSA checkpoints at over 250 airports. This feature, also available for digital driver's licenses in twelve states, offers a convenient alternative for domestic travel, though physical passports remain essential for international journeys.

title: India, Israel set to launch talks for free trade pact
content: India and Israel have officially launched negotiations for a free trade agreement, signing terms of reference to guide discussions. The pact aims to boost trade by removing barriers, facilitating investment, and enhancing cooperation in innovation and technology. Israel has assured India it won't seek market access in sensitive sectors like dairy and agriculture, opening new avenues for bilateral commerce.

title: 'Our youth are being profiled': Mehbooba flags harassment of Kashmiris; urges Omar to talk to Centre
content: Kashmiris are reportedly facing harassment and profiling in various parts of India after the Delhi car blast. Political leaders from Jammu and Kashmir are calling on the central government to intervene and guarantee the safety of all Indian citizens, including Kashmiris.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB nursing ankle ahead of Week 12 vs Jets
content: Baltimore Ravens' star quarterback Lamar Jackson's ankle injury had fans worried after he missed practice. However, a recent video shows Jackson heading to practice, raising hopes for his participation against the New York Jets. Coach John Harbaugh indicated it's a common physical toll of the sport, with availability for Sunday to be determined.

title: Pull off shelves drinks misusing 'ORS' tag, all states & UTs told
content: The FSSAI has ordered states and Union territories to immediately remove fruit-based beverages and other drinks misusing the term "ORS" from shelves. This directive follows earlier orders to stop the illegal and misleading practice. Enforcement drives will identify and remove non-compliant products, with regulatory action against violators. Genuine WHO-recommended Oral Rehydration Salts, classified as drugs, are exempt from this crackdown.

title: ‚ÄòWork will be optional‚Äô: Musk outlines AI future; says money may lose relevance
content: Elon Musk forecasts a future where work becomes optional for most people. He believes advancements in artificial intelligence and robotics will transform society. Humanoid robots, like Tesla's Optimus, could become the largest industry. This technological leap may also eliminate poverty and make everyone wealthy. Musk suggests money's relevance could diminish as resources become abundant through automation.

title: Is Giannis playing vs 76ers? Bucks star ruled out with groin strain
content: Milwaukee Bucks face a significant blow as Giannis Antetokounmpo is out with a left groin strain. This absence alters tonight's Eastern Conference clash against the Philadelphia 76ers. The Bucks are already dealing with depth issues. The 76ers also have injuries, including Joel Embiid being doubtful. This game becomes a test of team resilience for both sides.

title: Robert Vadra beneficiary of London asset: ED chargesheet
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a supplementary chargesheet against Robert Vadra in a money laundering case involving fugitive arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari. The ED alleges Vadra assisted Bhandari and benefited from a London property, claiming he possessed proceeds of crime. The court will decide on cognizance on December 6.

title: Candace Owens drops explosive claim on Charlie Kirk ‚Äòassassination‚Äô
content: Candace Owens questions the official narrative surrounding Charlie Kirk's shooting, suggesting a planned setup involving multiple individuals. She claims Tyler Robinson's role was limited, with his fingerprints not being the only ones on the weapon. Owens also alleges Lance Twiggs played a more significant, albeit different, part in the incident, citing a TMZ video as evidence.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs‚Äô role in violent elevator encounter
content: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: Is Joel Embiid playing vs Celtics? 76ers star ruled out with knee soreness
content: Philadelphia faces Boston tonight without star Joel Embiid, sidelined by right knee soreness for a fifth straight game.  The Sixers, also missing Paul George and Kelly Oubre Jr., rely on Andre Drummond and Tyrese Maxey to step up.  The Celtics are also dealing with key absences, including Jayson Tatum, making this a test of depth for both contenders.

title: Who's best No.4 Test batter? Not Kohli, Sachin or Lara; Ponting picks this cricketer
content: The former Australian men's cricket team captain chose fellow countryman Steve Smith over Miandad. He then picked Steve Smith over West Indies legend Brian Lara, and former South African all-rounder Jacques Kallis. Then put forward with a tough of choosing between Steve Smith and Virat Kohli, Ponting went with Smith. Then he also chose Smith over England batter Joe Root.

title: 'Terror module': Two ISI-linked operatives shot in Punjab; grenades, weapons seized
content: Two suspected ISI-backed module members were injured in a police encounter in Ludhiana after allegedly opening fire.  Acting on intelligence, police intercepted the duo who were tasked by a Pakistan-based handler to exchange grenades. Recoveries included grenades, pistols, and ammunition.

title: Smriti Mandhana flaunts ring; confirms engagement in dance with teammates - watch
content: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana has officially announced her engagement to music composer Palash Muchhal through a fun Instagram reel with teammates. The World Cup winner showcased her ring, confirming weeks of speculation. Muchhal was also in attendance for the World Cup final against South Africa. This personal milestone follows Mandhana's stellar performance in India's historic World Cup victory.

title: No more Russian oil: Reliance stops import; crude to be sourced from other nations
content: Effective November 20, Reliance Industries has transitioned away from importing Russian crude for its Jamnagar export-only refinery. By switching to non-Russian sources, the company is making a statement ahead of tightening EU restrictions. This early action positions Reliance to fully comply with product-import guidelines that are scheduled to come into play by January 2026.

title: Philadelphia 76ers vs Boston Celtics: Full injury report, who‚Äôs out
content: Philadelphia braces for a high-stakes November 20, 2025, clash against the Milwaukee Bucks.  With key players managing injuries, the game promises a tactical battle, potentially foreshadowing playoff encounters.  Expect standout performances from Justin Edwards and Tyrese Maxey for the Sixers, while Giannis stays sidelined for Miwaukee Bucks.  A nail-biting finish is anticipated.

title: Mind games! Aus Force tells English fans: Wait for instructions‚Ä¶ unlike Bairstow
content: Australia's Border Force playfully reignited the Jonny Bairstow stumping controversy ahead of the Ashes, urging English fans to follow instructions at the airport. The Australian Border Force posted a picture of Bairstow‚Äôs controversial stumping at Lord‚Äôs, which ignited Ashes series of 2023 in England, along with a message aimed at travelling English fans.

title: Watch: CM Nitish tries to touch PM's feet at Patna airport; RJD shares video
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar was seen attempting to touch Prime Minister Narendra Modi's feet at Patna airport before the PM's departure. This marks a recurring gesture from Kumar, who has previously shown similar deference to Modi on multiple occasions. The incident occurred shortly after Kumar's swearing-in for his tenth term as chief minister.

title: Don‚Äôt ignore these 5 subtle heart-failure indicators, including cough at night
content: Heart failure often develops subtly, with overlooked symptoms like unexplained weight gain, persistent cough when lying down, digestive issues, confusion, and sleep disturbances. Dr. Dmitry Yaranov stresses that recognizing these early warning signs is crucial for prompt medical care, effective management, and preventing serious complications, ultimately improving long-term heart health and quality of life.

title: Delhi blast: Lockers of docs in J&K searched; 'white collar' terror module under lens
content: Authorities intensified searches across hospitals and media offices in Jammu and Kashmir, probing links between medical staff, extremist modules, and fugitive operatives following the Delhi blast. Recoveries of arms and explosives from a "white-collar" terror module have fueled the investigation, with a media house also raided for alleged anti-national content.

title: WWE Survivor Series 2025: Men‚Äôs WarGames match announced with full lineup
content: WWE's 2025 Survivor Series, featuring the return of WarGames, is set for November 29th in San Diego. The main event pits Cody Rhodes and CM Punk against Roman Reigns and Brock Lesnar. John Cena also faces Dominik Mysterio for the Intercontinental Championship. The event will stream on Peacock, ESPN Unlimited, and Netflix.

title: 'Intellectual terrorists more dangerous': Cops on Delhi 2020 riots; flag worrying trend
content: Delhi Police informed the Supreme Court that "intellectuals becoming terrorists" pose a greater danger. They argued that activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, among others, are using trial delays to their advantage. The police presented evidence of "inflammatory speeches" and alleged the riots were timed with Donald Trump's visit to spark nationwide unrest and achieve "regime change."

title: 'We can wait': India is playing it cool on trade deal with US; what's its edge?
content: India is negotiating with the US from a position of strength, with its economy robust and export declines to America less severe than anticipated. Despite US tariffs, India's "ready to wait" approach allows it to push for favorable terms, while exporters are supported by trade deals and domestic measures.

title: Self-employment is creating most new jobs in India: What this means for job seekers
content: Self-employment has emerged as the fastest-growing segment in India‚Äôs labour market, rising from 23.9 crore in FY18 to 35.8 crore in FY24. It now accounts for over half of India‚Äôs total employment, with growth seen across both farm and non-farm sectors. Students and young professionals are exploring opportunities in freelancing, digital services, traditional businesses, and agricultural entrepreneurship. The trend highlights the need for skill development, entrepreneurial preparedness, and supportive policies to sustain independent work as formal jobs grow slowly.

title: Talaak-e-Hasan explained: Why it‚Äôs under scrutiny, and how it differs from triple talaq
content: The Supreme Court questioned the validity of Muslim men authorizing lawyers to issue Talaq-e-Hasan notices, deeming it a practice that leaves women vulnerable. The bench stressed that divorce requires the husband's direct pronouncement and signature, not delegation to third parties. This judicial scrutiny brings renewed attention to the constitutional validity of this divorce method.

title: Air combat: Russia makes big Su-57 offer to India; what's on the table
content: Russia has offered India unrestricted technology transfer for its Su-57 fifth-generation fighter jets, including production and licensing for critical components. This significant defence partnership aims to bolster India's future fighter aircraft needs, ensuring domestic manufacturing capabilities and long-term upgrades, reinforcing over six decades of cooperation ahead of President Putin's visit.

title: Raid on Kashmir Times office: Cops recover AK rifle cartridges, bullets; editors react
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police's State Investigation Agency raided the Jammu office of Kashmir Times. Officials stated the publication was involved in activities against the country. The search recovered AK rifle cartridges, pistol rounds, and hand-grenade pins. The newspaper management called the allegations baseless and an attempt to "silence independent journalism."

title: More pitch trouble? Bowling coach ahead of 2nd Test - 'If they cut the grass... '
content: South Africa's bowling coach, Piet Botha, is uncertain about the grass on the Guwahati pitch for the second Test, but anticipates better batting conditions than Kolkata's unpredictable surface. He expects moisture to aid the new ball in the opening hour, with toss decisions hinging on the wicket's final appearance. South Africa is also monitoring Kagiso Rabada's fitness.

title: Is John Tavares playing vs Blue Jackets? Maple Leafs injury update
content: Toronto Maple Leafs captain John Tavares remains a focal point ahead of tonight‚Äôs matchup against the Columbus Blue Jackets at Scotiabank Arena. With both teams looking to gain momentum, Tavares‚Äô availability could shape the outcome, especially with Toronto‚Äôs offense driving their early-season success. Here‚Äôs the latest update on whether Tavares will be in the lineup for this key Eastern Conference clash.

title: The right time to eat dinner in winter for better digestion and sleep
content: Winter's shorter days disrupt circadian rhythms, impacting metabolism and sleep. Research indicates that eating dinner earlier, ideally between 5:30 pm and 7:00 pm, significantly improves blood sugar control and digestion. Shifting calories to earlier meals and opting for lighter evening fare supports overall well-being during colder months.

title: 'Guv's can't sit on bills but ... ': What SC said on presidential reference - key points
content: Governors cannot indefinitely delay Bills passed by state legislatures, the Supreme Court ruled, emphasizing cooperative federalism. However, courts cannot set hard deadlines for governors or the President on Bills, nor can they grant 'deemed assent' or compel the President to seek judicial opinions. The ruling clarifies the limits of judicial intervention while upholding constitutional accountability.

title: Jobs, crime & funds: What Nitish must fix in his 10th term - explained
content: Nitish Kumar begins his 10th term as Bihar CM, facing significant challenges in job creation, stemming migration, and funding ambitious welfare promises. He must also restore his 'Sushasan Babu' image by improving law and order, while navigating complex political alliances. This term is crucial for Bihar's progress.

title: Cardi B inspires Stefon Diggs as Patriots WR battles painful ACL recovery
content: Stefon Diggs' remarkable comeback from a season-ending ACL tear is bolstered by girlfriend Cardi B's unwavering support.  Despite admitting to feeling "broken" during grueling rehab, Diggs impressed with an eight-and-a-half-month recovery, surpassing typical timelines.  Now signed with the Patriots, his journey highlights the crucial role of mental resilience and personal encouragement in professional sports.

title: 'No one wanted': Batting coach contradicts Gambhir; hits out at Kolkata wicket
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak strongly defended head coach Gautam Gambhir against criticism following the Kolkata Test loss to South Africa. "'Gautam Gambhir, Gautam Gambhir' (criticism) is being done. I am saying this because I am a staff and I feel bad. That's not the way," Kotak said on Thursday ahead of the second Test starting Saturday.

title: Another TACO? Trump admin may delay long-promised semiconductor tariffs
content: The Trump administration may delay imposing promised semiconductor tariffs, signaling a cautious approach to avoid provoking China and disrupting rare earth mineral supplies. While the White House denies a policy shift, reports suggest a potential postponement amid domestic concerns over rising consumer prices and a fragile trade truce with Beijing.

title: Manipur police sent incomplete, incorrect clips for forensic analysis, Kuki group tells Supreme Court
content: The Kuki Organisation for Human Rights Trust sought a court-monitored SIT to probe the matter of audio tapes sourced from a whistle-blower who claimed that they contain telephonic conversations of former Manipur C N. Biren Singh inciting ethnic conflict in the State

title: Protesters attempt to storm festival venue in Manipur; police resort to lathi charge
content: Agitators said authorities should first resolve the ethnic conflict in the State and resettle internally displaced persons before organising extravagant festivals; Metei outfit to hold mass sit-in today

title: India seeks a ‚Äòjust transition mechanism‚Äô at climate talks
content: India says that finance to adapt to climate change is an ‚Äòessential investment‚Äô and not an ‚Äòoptional add-on‚Äô; Environment Minister Bhupendra Yadav says ‚Äòjust transition‚Äô includes ‚Äústrengthening resilience... creating employment, protecting livelihoods, eradicating poverty, ensuring food security, and providing social protection‚Äù

title: SC‚Äôs advisory opinion offers mixed bag of opportunities for Kerala
content: State may be able to take up the case of Bills pending either with the Governor or President beyond a ‚Äòreasonable time‚Äô based on the court‚Äôs decision on limited judicial review. But the no-timeline verdict can act as a setback

title: Chief Minister Stalin will bring Metro Rail to Coimbatore, Madurai, says Senthilbalaji
content: Mr. Senthilbalaji alleged that the Centre had not initially sanctioned funds for the Chennai Metro Rail project either, but the DMK government implemented it

title: Doctors, engineers turning to terror, more dangerous than ‚Äòground-level‚Äô terrorists: Delhi Police to Supreme Court
content: The police played videos of Sharjeel Imam speaking at Chakhand, Jamia, Aligarh and Asansol in the years and months before the riots in February 2020, saying he had both instigated and provoked the crowd

title: The ‚Äògame-changer‚Äô in the Bihar election 2025
content: While the scale of the NDA‚Äôs victory was resounding, there needs to be closer analysis of the much-touted impact of the new ‚ÄòMY‚Äô vote ‚Äî Mahila (women) and Yuva (youth-vote)

content: Formed in ideological opposition to the Hindutva agenda of the BJP, the JD(S) has had an inconsistent run both in terms of ideology and electoral fortunes

content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah referred to his days in the Janata Dal (Secular) and said that had he continued in that party, he would never have become Chief Minister

content: Panel is expected to recommend Karnataka Outsources Employees (Regulation, Placement and Welfare) Bill, 2025, to prohibit outsourcing personnel

title: IFFI 2025: Goa opens first-ever carnival parade, premieres Gabriel Mascaro‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Blue Trail‚Äô, and launches WAVES Film Bazaar
content: A street-side carnival, a Silver Bear‚Äìwinning Brazilian premiere, and a rebranded film market set the pace as IFFI 2025 opened in Goa with fresh ambition

title: State cannot regulate foreign universities: Higher Education Minister
content: M.C. Sudhakar said that foreign universities are autonomous institutions like private universities and deemed-to-be universities and have received permission directly from the University Grants Commission

title: State, VC firms together disburse ‚Çπ400 cr to deep-tech start-ups at tech summit
content: ‚ÄòFor the first time ever a government and and a pack¬†of VCs came together to distribute funds to start-ups‚Äô

title: A.P. to launch ‚ÄòRytanna ‚Äì Mee Kosam‚Äô to empower farmers
content: The drive, involving visits by MLAs to farmers‚Äô houses, is designed to educate them on modern cultivation methods and the State‚Äôs new five-point strategy for making agriculture profitable; workshops will also be conducted at Rythu Seva Kendras on December 3

title: ICG apprehends Bangladeshi boat with 28 crew members for illegal fishing in Indian waters
content: This is the fourth such apprehension in a week, highlighting the Coast Guard‚Äôs sustained efforts to curb illegal fishing and safeguard India‚Äôs maritime interests

title: Naidu, Lokesh attend Nitish Kumar‚Äôs swearing-in ceremony in Patna
content: In a post on social media, he expresses hope that the NDA leadership in Bihar will deliver successful, people-centric governance

title: Watch: Why has a Rs. 300 crore land deal sparked a political storm¬†in¬†Maharashtra? | Pulse Maharashtra
content: At the heart of a controversial land deal in Pune, which has created trouble for Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar‚Äôs son Parth Pawar, is a government officer. An officer, who the government itself now says, is used to misusing his power. What is the land deal? Who is this officer? And why is it that a demand for a fair probe continues despite the appointment of a high level committee? We speak to RTI activist Vijay Kumbhar.

content: Reactions differ on whether the ‚Äòdeemed assent‚Äô granted by the top court on the 10 Tamil Nadu Bills via its Article 142 powers will be impacted

title: Frontline wins three Laadli media awards
content: Population First, which is supported by the United Nations Population Fund, has been recognising journalists and creators in news media and advertising for their work on gender sensitivity since the year 2007 through the Laadli awards

content: Collector Himanshu Shukla inquires about road accidents taking place in Kandukur and Atmakur divisions

content: Discussed ways to strengthen our trade, connectivity, and people-to-people ties, says External Affairs Minister

title: Kerala HC seeks steps to prevent vlogging inside driver compartment of moving buses, lorries
content: Motor vehicles that flouted safety standards in this manner, posing threat to the safety of passengers and other road users must be penalised, says HC

title: Telangana will establish India‚Äôs first North East Annexe, says Chief Minister Revanth Reddy
content: The festival was designed to celebrate cultural unity and strengthen ties between Telangana and the North Eastern states, it represented a bond that had long been overlooked, the Chief Minister said

title: India‚Äôs annual maximum temperatures increased across most States from 0.1¬∞C to 0.5¬∞C during last decade: Report
content: This persistent warming has directly translated into record-breaking electricity demand, reaching around 250 GW during the summer of 2024, largely due to surging cooling needs across residential, commercial, and industrial sectors, the report points out

content: The evidence gathered by the ED indicates that the property acquired by Sanjay Bhandari was ‚Äòbeneficially used by Robert Vadra‚Äô

content: 26-year-old woman, a native of Nedumangadu, had developed fever and headache in the first week of October

content: The Congress and the BJP have sought to push the arrest of Padmakumar and, earlier, former Devaswom Commissioner N. Vasu, both CPI(M)‚Äôs political appointees, to the top of their election rhetoric in the spirited campaigning for the local body polls in December

title: Global summit will focus on democratising AI, says Safirulla
content: At the India AI Impact Summit, which will be hosted by New Delhi in Feb. 2026, global tech leaders will also address issues surrounding the fear of job losses and equipping job-seekers to meet the needs of the changing job market, says the director, IndiaAI Mission

title: Family of three murdered accuses police of failing to arrest accused
content: BJP says political influence shielding accused Vijay Halli and Shankar Allolli who are close associates of Minister Priyank Kharge

content: The five, all Muslims, were adjudged non-citizens by a Foreigners‚Äô Tribunal in Sonitpur district on October 24

title: Kharif paddy procurement hits a new high this season in Andhra Pradesh
content: As of November 20, a quantum of 3,49,061 tonnes of paddy has been procured, which is the highest among the last three seasons, says official

title: India seeks energy security of island nations, pitches for solar power
content: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said the island nations face ‚Äúunique vulnerabilities due to their dependence on imported fossil fuels, climate-related disruptions and fragile infrastructure‚Äù

content: An independent inquiry has been initiated into the case of precipitated labour, according to P.R. Havanoor

title: Passenger information system, QR code ready for launch in city
content: It is part of the phased rollout of BUSZ, an advanced mobility solution for transforming public transport with smart solutions

title: Arrest of former TDB president Padmakumar raises new questions
content: Information has emerged that the initial application regarding the gold, submitted by Unnikrishnan Potti , was received not by the TDB but the Devaswom department  under Kadakampally Surendran

title: Activists demand statehood for North Karnataka to become prosperous
content: ‚ÄòSuccessive governments have neglected the region and the only way for growth is by attaining statehood‚Äô

title: Fixing what's wrong with Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus, more
content: the defending champions have lost five of six in league play to fall to eighth in the table . the german side have lost seven of 10 in all competitions . there are plenty of signs that players are still grieving and struggling with the death of teammate Diogo Jota .

title: Russian Army Claims Capture Of Key East Ukraine City
content: The Russian army claimed on Thursday to have again captured the Ukrainian city of Kupiansk, a key Kyiv bastion in the eastern Kharkiv region where Russia's soldiers have been steadily advancing.

title: I Practice Buddhism, I'm Truly Secular: CJI BR Gavai In His Farewell Speech
content: The Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Thursday said that though he practices Buddhism as his faith, he is a truly secular person who believes in every religion, including Hinduism, Sikhism, Islam and others.

title: White House Says US Not Taking Part In G20 Talks In South Africa
content: The United States is not taking part in this weekend's G20 summit in Johannesburg, the White House said Thursday, denying comments from South Africa's president who had said Washington wanted to participate.

title: After Trump Documentary, BBC Under Fire Over Discredited Diana Interview
content: The BBC came under fire again Thursday in a new book about its bombshell interview with the late Princess Diana, 30 years after it was aired.

title: Google Developing Safe, Trusted AI To Protect Vulnerable Users In India
content: Google on Thursday said that it is developing safe and trusted Artificial Intelligence as part of a broader effort to protect vulnerable users in India, emphasising that safety must serve as the foundation for transformational AI.

title: Belgium Court To Hear Mehul Choksi's Appeal Against Extradition On December 9
content: The case of fugitive diamond trader Mehul Choksi challenging his extradition will come up for hearing before Belgium's supreme court -- the Court of Cassation -- on December 9, officials said on Thursday.

title: Food Regulator Orders Removal Of Any Products Misleadingly Labelled 'ORS'
content: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India issued an order directing the immediate removal of fruit-based beverages, ready-to-serve drinks, energy drinks, electrolyte drinks and similar products that use the term "ORS" in their brand names.

title: UP Javelin Thrower Annu Rani, Husband Charged For Celebratory Firing
content: International javelin thrower Annu Rani and her husband, national kickboxer Sahil Bhardwaj, were booked on Wednesday after they were found firing celebratory shots during their wedding, in a video that went viral on social media, police said.

title: 'Appreciate Partnership': US After Deported Gansgter Anmol Bishnoi Arrest
content: The United States on Thursday underscored its strong security cooperation with India following the arrest of fugitive gangster Anmol Bishnoi, who was deported from the US and taken into custody by the National Investigation Agency (NIA).

title: Fire Breaks Out At Main Venue Of COP30 Summit In Brazil, None Injured
content: Parts of the venue for the COP30 climate summit in the Brazilian city of Belem were being evacuated on Thursday following reports of a fire.

title: Whether Government Knows Or Not, We Are Concerned: Mohan Bhagwat In Manipur
content: Mohan Bhagwat, the chief of the BJP's ideological mentor Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, has told the people of Manipur that the state has been in the thoughts of the organisation even if the government did not know about it.

title: UK Doubles Settlement Period To 10 Years Under New 'Earned' Migration Model
content: The UK government tabled its proposal in Parliament on Thursday to double the period international migrants, including Indians, would be expected to wait before applying for indefinite leave to remain (ILR) under a new "earned settlement" model.

title: When AI Tries To Identify AI: Chatbots Fail To Detect Images They Created
content: When outraged Filipinos turned to an AI-powered chatbot to verify a viral photograph of a lawmaker embroiled in a corruption scandal, the tool failed to detect that it was fabricated -- even though it had generated the image itself.

title: UK's Covid Lockdown Delay Led To 23,000 Excess Deaths: Report
content: UK's government-level response to the COVID pandemic was often a case of "too little, too late", and a week's delay in imposing a mandatory lockdown during first wave in 2020 led to approximately 23,000 excess deaths, an official inquiry concluded.

title: "Ready For Whatever Happens": Zohran Mamdani Gears Up To Meet Trump
content: New York's incoming leftist mayor, Zohran Mamdani, said he was "ready for whatever happens" when he meets US President Donald Trump in Washington on Friday, stressing their shared desire to tackle the cost of living.

title: Headmaster, 3 Teachers Of Delhi School Suspended After 16-Year-Old's Suicide
content: Two days after a student of St Columba's School in Delhi died by suicide by jumping from the platform of a Metro station, school authorities have suspended the principal and three teachers who were named in the FIR filed by the teen's father.

title: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia Skip 'Phansi Ghar' Probe Meet Again
content: Former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and ex-Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday skipped the Delhi Assembly's Privileges Committee meeting for the second time, deepening the political standoff over the controversial "Phansi Ghar" i

title: Israel Says It Still Has "Military Edge" Despite US-Saudi F-35 Jet Deal
content: Israel expects to maintain access to more advanced US weaponry, a government spokesperson said on Thursday when asked about Washington's plan to sell F-35 warplanes to Saudi Arabia.

title: India To Send 2 Aquanauts To Explore Ocean Depths In 'Samudrayaan Mission'
content: Two scientists from a top ocean institute will pilot a 28-tonne indigenously built manned submersible up to 500 metres deep off the Chennai coast early next year.

title: Trump Floats Death Penalty For Democrats Asking Military To Refuse Orders
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday evoked the death penalty for Democratic lawmakers who urged the military to refuse illegal orders, calling them traitors and accusing them of sedition.

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5‚Äôs flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Eagles' kelly green, Texans' battle red uniforms top NFL Week 12 threads
content: the Houston Texans are wearing their all-battle-red threads on "Thursday Night Football" the combination debuted last season and features a bullhorn on the helmet and shoulder . the Eagles remain undefeated in the look since it debuted in 2023 . for the first time in franchise history, the saints are wearing all-black .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Ohio State, Miami, Iowa on the rise
content: a wave of commitments, decommitments and flips largely driven by three-star prospects shook up these rankings . the number of remaining undeclared prospects in the SC Next 300 is in single digits, but heading into the initial signing period for the 2026 class, many factors can still drive changes .

content: Tejashwi (File photo) The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. title: How can we reduce CO2?
content: greenhouse gas traps heat in the atmosphere and CO2 levels have increased dramatically since the Industrial Revolution . this is leading to a steep rise in global temperatures, with ever more severe consequences, including storms, flooding, drought and days of extreme heat . the COP30 summit in Belem marks a decade since the historic Paris Agreement .

title: How the Nuremberg Trials prosecuted Nazi war criminals
content: the major war crimes trial against 24 high-ranking representatives of the naz state began on November 20, 1945 . more than 230 witnesses were questioned, 300,000 statements were read out . the choice of Nuremberg as the venue for the trial was not arbitrary .

title: What happened to last year's AFC juggernauts? Chiefs, Ravens and Texans are all 5-5
content: defending division champions have plenty of work to do in order to reach the postseason . the Texans are thriving in the AFC, including the new England Patriots (9-2) the texans have found their franchise quarterback in Drake Maye and the Denver Broncos .
